## Who I Am

I am Mao Yang, a first-year Master of Science (ScM) student in the Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology at Johns Hopkins University. Originally from southwestern China, I bring a unique perspective to my research in cancer biology and aging.

## Professional Interests

My research focuses on understanding the molecular mechanisms underlying therapy resistance in cancer cells, with a particular emphasis on how aging processes contribute to this phenomenon. I am passionate about:

-   **Cancer Biology**: Investigating how cancer cells develop resistance to therapeutic interventions
-   **Aging Research**: Understanding the intersection between aging and cancer progression
-   **Molecular Mechanisms**: Exploring cellular pathways that contribute to disease progression
-   **Translational Research**: Bridging the gap between basic science and clinical applications
